snippet: The Lenox Lounge, which opened in 1942, will close on Dec. 31 and will reopen next year under a new owner, worrying regulars who feel it will lose its appeal.
abstract: Lenox Lounge, which opened in Harlem in 1942 and became a home for jazz greats, will close on Dec 31; owner Alvin Reed says he can no longer afford the lease; facility will reopen in 2013 under a new owner,  worrying regulars who feel it will lose its appeal and its connection to the community.
lead_paragraph: The Lenox Lounge, which opened in 1942, will close on Dec. 31 and will reopen next year under a new owner, worrying regulars who feel it will lose its appeal.

headline.seo: Harlem to Say Goodbye to the Lenox Lounge
headline.main: Harlem to Say Goodbye to an Art Deco Haven of Jazz
headline.print_headline: Harlem to Say Goodbye to an Art Deco Haven of Jazz
